snippet: Kirk Noble Bloodsworth, the nation’s first death row inmate exonerated by DNA, is pressing to end capital punishment in Maryland, the state that sought his execution.
abstract: Kirk Noble Bloodsworth, nation’s first death row inmate exonerated by DNA, has led long campaign to end capital punishment in Maryland, state that sought his execution; state appears poised to end the practice, as both political and public opinion turn against it.
lead_paragraph: Kirk Noble Bloodsworth, the nation’s first death row inmate exonerated by DNA, is pressing to end capital punishment in Maryland, the state that sought his execution.

headline.seo: Exonerated Inmate Seeks End to Maryland Death Penalty
headline.main: A Death Penalty Fight Comes Home
headline.print_headline: A Death Penalty Fight Comes Home
